channel.title: I've got this server
channel.description:
I have a server source for a game called Rillaspora or probaby Diadoxx (It's from 2004-2005 i think) It's programmed in Java but whenever I try to compile i get errors, how the fuck can I get errors? How was it programmed then if there are errors..
So I was wondering if 1 of you guys could check it out and help me fix all of that so i can finaly edit the java files and compile cause I can't seem to do it myself.. :(
Link: http://www.multiupload.com/6S1VDN5V7O
Thanks in advance. :rolleyes:
P.S.: Sorry if i'm not allowed to request this.

item.title: I've got this server
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

[quote=“Nueb35, post:13, topic:323918”][quote author=Mitko link=topic=420315.msg3205311#msg3205311 date=1273752986]
Guess i’ll install XP then, thanks for the help.
[/quote]

why not install the windows vm of xp in vista or 7, then run under compatibility of win xp?[/quote]I download the so called “Win Vista compatible” vm, restart after the installation and after i rebooted i tried to run the server and it still didn’t work, went to some website that uses some java applet to check if you have vm installed and it said i don’t but i did install it.

Do you mean start the setup in winxp compability mode?

EDIT: Just did that, rebooted, still the same.

Read full topic

oksuper_:

try java StartServer ??

item.title: I've got this server
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You are going to have to fix it so it doesn’t use microsoft-specific classes, that’s pretty much the only solution you have besides using an ancient version of windows.

Read full topic

item.title: I've got this server
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:7, topic:323918”][quote author=Mitko link=topic=420315.msg3204485#msg3204485 date=1273670156]
I still can’t figure out what is it’s problem.

I also forgot to mention that it uses Microsoft Java Virtual Machine, the run script is:

@rem Diaspora server launcher @jview StartServer.class @echo off

Downloaded a version for windows vista but it just won’t install vm. Any way of running this with some IDE or jdk?
[/quote]edit nvm…[/quote]I know, sorry for gravedigging but i really want to start this up again. When i was on XP i just installed microsoft vm and it was all working perfect. In vista and 7 it won’t and i don’t feel like going back to xp.

Read full topic

@Mitko wrote:

I still can’t figure out what is it’s problem.

I also forgot to mention that it uses Microsoft Java Virtual Machine to be ran, the run script is:

Downloaded a version for windows vista but it just won’t install vm. Any way of running this with some IDE or jdk?

item.title: I've got this server
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I think you’ll need to change your run script to something like this:

@echo off cd src javac -d ../bin -cp . com\ms\wfc\*.java pause

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

Looks like it’s missing the library’s or a package.

AiDatabaseWrapper.java:6: package com.ms.wfc.data does not exist import com.ms.wfc.data.*;
